properties.address: United Reformed Church, Oxford, Oxfordshire OX3 8HW
properties.description: Our Community Coffee Lounge is currently open as a warm space for the local community. We are currently open from 10am-1pm every Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday. Come along and enjoy free light refreshments (and soup in from November), meet other members of the community, make new friends, whilst having the opportunity to borrow books and DVD’s from the lending library. Why not come and make yourself at home with us? Everyone is welcome to come to the coffee lounge at COLLINWOOD ROAD CHURCH, RISINGHURST (Collinwood Rd, Headington, Oxford OX3 8HW). We hope you will enjoy a warm welcome to a warm space, with a chance to get to know your neighbours and make new friends.

properties.title: Talking Cafe for community connections in OX4

properties.description: @Flo's - The Place in the Park. Pay-As-You-Can on Mondays From 12-2pm on Mondays our normal menu is suspended and instead we will be serving a delicious hot lunch, sweet treat and hot and cold drinks on a “pay what you can basis”. There is no judgement and how much you pay is anonymous- everyone is welcome! The café is open the rest of the time from 10am until 4pm serving delicious brunch, hot lunch specials, sandwiches, salads, and sweets, expertly roasted coffee. All the money spent at the café feeds into the local economy and funds our community activities at Flo’s. Pay-as-you-can Mondays are part of the OX4 Food Crew- a partnership of local organisations working to tackle food inequality in OX4.

properties.description: Monday – Saturday 10am – 5pm. Older People’s Programme free sessions Tea & Talk - A cup of tea and chat with other older people and our friendly volunteers. • 11th November • 9th December • 13th January • 10th February Memory Lane – a themed reminiscence session, which is a chance to share stories and memories plus enjoy a cup of tea or coffee afterwards. Please contact us in advance to book a place so we have idea of numbers for catering. Please email museum@oxford.gov.uk or phone 01865 252334 or drop in to the Museum.
